title: bug(forge): blockhash collisions happen when jumping to a future block using vm.roll
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (25d3ce7 2023-08-01T00:20:16.462585000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test, forge script

### Operating System

macOS (Intel)

### Describe the bug

In `forge test` and `forge script`, blockhash collisions happen when jumping to a _future_ block using `vm.roll`.
This bug is the cause that it is impossible to test a contract that assumes that the hashes of (most recent) blocks do not conflict.

For example, the following script should be run without an error.

```solidity
// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.13;

import {Script, console2} from "forge-std/Script.sol";

contract BlockhashScript is Script {
    event Log(bytes32 blockhash);

    function setUp() public {}

    function run() public {
        uint256 startBlockNumber = block.number - 4;
        for (uint256 i = 1; i < 10; i++) {
            vm.roll(startBlockNumber + i);
            emit Log(blockhash(block.number - 1));
            require(blockhash(block.number - 2) != blockhash(block.number - 1), "blockhash collision");
        }
    }
}
```

But, the following error occurs.

```
$ forge script BlockhashScript -vvvvv
[⠘] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped
Traces:

  [98] BlockhashScript::setUp() 
    └─ ← ()

    ├─ emit Log(blockhash: 0x0092412b22376a0006c4c5c41e4e3358ab90cae35ecb59068e4ec54c19d37a22)

    │   └─ ← ()

    ├─ [0] VM::roll(9442672 [9.442e6]) 
    │   └─ ← ()
    ├─ emit Log(blockhash: 0x937128da880ad7c5fa693b7de70f14fbb1c6c612013e409ba5d3e0aff73f3c9b)
    ├─ [0] VM::roll(9442673 [9.442e6]) 
    │   └─ ← ()
    ├─ emit Log(blockhash: 0xc5d2460186f7233c927e7db2dcc703c0e500b653ca82273b7bfad8045d85a470)

    │   └─ ← ()
    ├─ emit Log(blockhash: 0xc5d2460186f7233c927e7db2dcc703c0e500b653ca82273b7bfad8045d85a470)
    └─ ← "blockhash collision"


Error: 
blockhash collision
```

I think it would be better to return random block hashes for blocks not yet built.

Full source code: https://github.com/minaminao/foundry-bug-reports/tree/main/2023-08-blockhash-bug

The same problem occurs in on-chain tracing without `vm.roll` and with the `--slow` option, because `block.number` is incremented.

```solidity
// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.13;

import {Script, console2} from "forge-std/Script.sol";
import {Vm} from "forge-std/Vm.sol";

contract CollisionOnChainScript is Script {
    function setUp() public {}

    function run() public {
        vm.startBroadcast();
        Contract c = new Contract();
        for (uint256 i = 1; i < 10; i++) {
            c.f();
        }
    }
}

contract Contract {
    // do not add view
    function f() public {
        require(blockhash(block.number - 2) != blockhash(block.number - 1), "blockhash collision");
    }
}
```
